derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: from Urdu and Persian parda 'veil, curtain'

entry.tran: （伊斯兰或印度教社会的）置身深闺，深闺制度
entry.def: Purdah is a custom practised in some Muslim and Hindu societies, in which women either remain in a special part of the house or cover their faces and bodies to avoid being seen by men who are not related to them. If a woman is in purdah, she lives according to this custom.

means.word_mean: 2. the traditional Hindu or Muslim system of keeping women secluded
3. a screen used in India to separate women from men or strangers
